questions.text: What is in the vault in this level?
questions.explanation:
Shadow Power.

	In the vault, you get the Shadow Power move.  This allows you to move around in front of guards without being seen, but you move very slowly and for a very limited time!  The vault is in the laser room you enter during Murray's mission.

questions.text: What has the "O" in "Anatomy" been changed to on the title screen?
questions.explanation:
Gear.

	The "o" is changed into a metal gear, representing the construction of Clockwerk.  Sly tries to destroy Clockwerk, but instead of destroying it, he accidentally locks the pieces in place, completing Clockwerk.

questions.text: Which of these is not a character you must take a recon photo of?
questions.explanation:
Clock-La.

	Clock-La has not been created at the time of you taking the recon photos.  You see Arpeggio and Neyla talking in a room, and must take pictures of them, and Clockwerk is hanging up being built.  You also take a picture of the mech eggs and the electro-inducer.

Clock-La shoots him.

	At first, Neyla knocks Arpeggio down as he is on his way to combine his body with Clockwerk.  He gets very angry that Neyla pushed him out of the way, but he dies when Neyla, who has now combined herself with Clockwerk to make Clock-La, shoots him.

questions.text: Which of these is not a mission?
questions.explanation:
Sly/Carmelita Join Forces.

	For three of the missions you must complete in this level, you must destroy bombs on Arpeggio's blimp.  The titles are the combinations of duos that can be formed; Sly and Bentley, Bentley and Murray, and Murray and Sly.  You only pair up with Carmelita at the end, when you fight Clock-La.

questions.text: How must you break the rotating light bulbs in one of the missions?
options: Sly whacks each set with his cane
Murray belly flops on each set
questions.explanation:
Bentley shoots each set down.

	Bentley uses his dart gun to shoot the 24 light bulbs.  There are twelve on the top and twelve on the bottom.  Once he shoots one of the bulbs, he must shoot the bulb that is paired with it on the ceiling, or the place will explode and you fail your mission.

questions.text: What city does Arpeggio want to hypnotize?
questions.explanation:
Paris.

	Arpeggio decides that he wants to hypnotize Paris with hate.  He wants to do this because in order for Clockwerk to stay alive, he must be powered by eternal hate.  Hypnotizing Paris would generate enough hate for Clockwerk to stay alive forever.

questions.text: Who is the gunner for Carmelita when you are fighting Clock-La?
questions.explanation:
Sly.

	Carmelita joins forces with the gang to destroy Clock-La.  She controls the helicopter while Sly shoots Clock-La down.  While you are fighting Clock-La, Carmelita gives positive reinforcement.  Unless, of course, you get hit by Clock-La, in which case she makes fun of you.

questions.text: What vital piece keeps Clock-La alive?
questions.explanation:
The Hate Chip.

	The Hate Chip is what keeps Clock-La alive.  With it, even though she was defeated, she is still powerful.  Once she is on the ground, Murray and Bentley team up to get the chip from her mouth.  Once you do this, she explodes.  The explosion does not destroy the Clockwerk parts, as they remained almost perfect, eternal.  However, since the Hate Chip has been removed, age starts to catch up with the mechanical owl, and he rots away.

questions.text: How does Bentley get his legs injured?
questions.explanation:
Clock-La's face falls on him.

	When Bentley is trying to get the Hate Chip from Clock-La's mouth, Murray is no longer holding her face up.  So when Bentley finally gets the chip, Clock-La can no longer hold her face up, so it crashes down onto Bentley, crushing his legs!
